How does Ozempic work?

Ozempic works by slowing the digestion process, and can help you to feel full for longer. Ozempic, acts like a hormone your body naturally makes to regulate blood sugar and help support weight loss.

Ozempic treats type 2 diabetes but may be prescribed for weight loss, if appropriate.

90% of clients lost up to 2% of their body fat within the first week of using Ozempic.

Most Popular Questions

Ozempic for weight loss has shown to be successful with patients losing weight in clinical trials.

Ozempic typically costs between $800 to $1,000 per month without insurance for a 4-week supply. Prices can vary based on location, pharmacy, and insurance coverage, with some discount programs available to reduce costs.

While taking Ozempic, there are no specific foods that must be avoided. However, it’s best to limit high-fat, greasy, or sugary foods as they can exacerbate gastrointestinal side effects like nausea. A balanced diet with whole foods, lean proteins, and vegetables is recommended to support overall health and medication effectiveness.

The most common side effects of Ozempic include:

  • Nausea

  • Diarrhea

  • Vomiting

  • Stomach pain

  • Constipation

These side effects are usually mild and tend to improve as your body adjusts to the medication. If they persist or worsen, consult your healthcare provider.

The cost of metabolic testing varies significantly based on the complexity and type of test. Basic metabolic tests can range from $75 to $200, while more advanced or comprehensive tests at specialized clinics can cost between $300 and $1,000. Insurance coverage can also impact the final cost.

Ozempic works by mimicking the action of a natural hormone called GLP-1, which helps regulate blood sugar, slow down digestion and reduce appetite. By making you feel fuller faster and longer, Ozempic can help you eat less, leading to weight loss. It’s typically used alongside diet and exercise to achieve the best results.

Yes, Ozempic is a prescription medication, and you need a doctor’s prescription to use it for weight loss. It’s important to have a medical consultation to determine if Ozempic is the right option for you, as it may not be suitable for everyone, especially those with certain medical conditions or who are taking specific medications.
